column4: sudo apt-get install --reinstall virtualbox (or virtualbox-ose) will replace anything that might have accidently been deleted or lost. Then try the vboxdrv command.
That's OK, so long as the kernel modules are gone. Run "lsmod | grep vbox" and tell me if you get anything.
nothing
Now do the install command and paste the output.
Did you previously install the version from Oracle?
i think so
OK. That's why it's not working now. The virtualbox-ose version is only at 4.0.4 while the one from Oracle is 4.0.10. It won't replace a newer version with an older version.
Do you still have the downloaded file from Oracle?
Download it again, then "sudo dpkg -i /path/to/downloaded/file"
It wouldn't hurt to do so, just to be safe.
i think this is the one
http://pastebin.com/L6kZ8yiV
you still here?
I'm here, just studying up.
this is result from dpkg command
Spelling or typing errors are most likely. Linux is cAsE sensitive, so "downloads" is different from "Downloads".
all working now thanks for all your help your a lifesaver
You don't want to make an iso file executable.
iTunes is supposed to work fairly well in Wine.
